website_summaries.verdict: The best budget rescue throw bag meant for quick rescues on water, and even land use.
pros: Simple and clear instructions are printed along the outside of the bag for use in an emergency
The polyester surface can be used on land or out in rough weather
cons: Storage strap does not include a UV-resistant coating, allowing the sun to bleach the surface

customer_reviews.title: good price But
customer_reviews.text: Bag has a great price and easy to use. But the storage strap is not protected from UV rays the white storage strap has rotted from the sun. Luckily when the strap broke it didn't fall overboard. You can tear the strap with your hand. It will cost more to have repaired than to just buy another. I'll probably look at other brands or I'll be replacing this every year. If you keep it out of the sun you may be okay. But you want it to be ready to use. In a cabin or drawer may take too long to get to in a emergency .
customer_reviews.author: MA

customer_reviews.title: Purchase is as expected.
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for a high quality throw bag, this is not it. However if your lifeguards are not good at keeping their gear dry, which is hard on gear, why buy the expensive ones. These work fine for basic throws and will last at least a season without destroying our more expensive ones.
customer_reviews.author: Suki W.

customer_reviews.title: life span of bag wasn’t as long as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Have had this on boat dock, exposed on dock post next to life preserver ring...the canvas bag basically disintegrated afte about 14 months. Thought it might last longer. Overall a very good product up until the bag tears apart.
customer_reviews.author: DCR

customer_reviews.title: Great Throw Bag
customer_reviews.text: There was such a difference in price between the different throw bags that I was a little apprehensive purchasing the least expensive one. But I took the plunge and bought two of them. As soon as they arrived I tested them out and they worked great. As long as the length of 50 vs 75 feet works for you, I do not believe you will be dissapointed. I have worked in water rescue for 32 years and used various different types of rescue lines. Throw Bags are the way to go. Easy to use and effective
customer_reviews.author: L. Kent

customer_reviews.title: had a recent water rescue drill and of all the ...
customer_reviews.text: had a recent water rescue drill and of all the bags that were being used . This product was the easiest and most consistant in deploying. Of all the bags this bag was prefferred by most of the students.
customer_reviews.author: milton

customer_reviews.title: This bag is probably great for those who are using it on boats or ...
customer_reviews.text: This bag is probably great for those who are using it on boats or off docks or things like that, but I bought it for white water kayaking. I don't think the rope is strong enough. After completing a swift water rescue course I was left wishing I bought a thicker rope that could be used for a variety of rescue situations like removing a pinned boat or others. Not sure it's good enough for those uses.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Throws well
customer_reviews.text: Nice addition to my yakking equipment. I was leary about how well it would throw but really flies nicely. Only dry test tosses so far, but I'm happy with the initial quality and design. Hopefully it will never be needed.
customer_reviews.author: mh

customer_reviews.title: Dont go out in your boat without this...ever
customer_reviews.text: Last week I had a near miss with someone in trouble in the water. I had just a line and a cushion but I managed to help them. As soon as I got home that afternoon I got online and ordered this Throw Bag; it arrived in a day and half. I took it outside on land and practiced throwing it. This thing works great. With a little practice you can hit a target 50 ft away with accuracy. I will never go on the water again without this. It is a true life saver. Buy it now and use it!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen J.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Keep on our kayaks.. Makes me feel safer having them
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kwik Tek LL-1 is great.
customer_reviews.text: This rope bag is a must for all boaters. You may never need it, but it's nice to have if you need to help someone else. Wind, current and the human factor contribute to many accidents. This is just another safety tool in the tool box. It's 50ft which is plenty in most cases. They also make a 75ft. Please read the directions and practice at least once or twice before hanging it on your vessel. Some other brands can be expensive but I found this one to be reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Mike From FL

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to aim and throw
customer_reviews.text: A MUST for every boat! I have one of these on my boat, and we also teach our youth Sea Scouts how to use them. I have a friend who went through the ice while ice sailing, and this bag actually saved his life -- someone was carrying one in their car. It is easy to aim and throw. If you have a boat, or are ever near the water, then you need a throw bag for sure!
customer_reviews.author: cwhittt

customer_reviews.title: Works great on its own, or attached to life ring
customer_reviews.text: We use these on our boats, and have found them to be very easy to use and reliable. If you want to use this to replace the standard coil of floating line on a life ring, you simple clip the bag onto the life ring, and secure the bitter end to the boat. You just throw the ring, and the line pays out from the bag. Great product, and don't let the low price fool you.. its as good as any other.
customer_reviews.author: E. Perrone

customer_reviews.title: Kwik Tek LL-1 Life Line Throw Bag
customer_reviews.text: Ordered and received a Kwik Tek LL-1 Life Line Throw Bag. Upon arrival, it appears well built with very basic instructions printed on carry bag. Took it into my yard and was able to accurately throw it, deploying the majority of line with ease. My purpose for this item is to carry it on my kayak and frankly, I hope I never have to use it, but feel confident it willl do the job should the need arise. I consider it a quality item that's well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: David D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Hope I never need it...
customer_reviews.text: I am a law enforcement officer in a rural area of Florida, that is surrounded by a river and has many lakes and ponds. I keep this in my patrol vehicle as in case it's ever needed. For the price, it's worth my piece of mind. I hope I never have to use it, but if I do, I'm sure it will do its job. The case seems well stitched and is compact.
customer_reviews.author: NorthFloridaLT

customer_reviews.title: Have used often, works great!
customer_reviews.text: I use this little throw bag in the "water rescue" portion of thw Wilderness First Aid class I teach. With a quick dip in the water, it throw's well. The bag has probably had more use than most have in their lifetime with all the practicing we do and it has held up with only one minor repair. The rope is soft and limp enough to not tangle and re-stuffs easily. Don't discount this one because ti is the cheapest!
customer_reviews.author: andyfly

customer_reviews.title: Great peace of mind product!
customer_reviews.text: I choose this mostly because of other reviews and have to agree. The bright orange seems to catch the eye of every guest on board which I love as they seem to understand my committment to safety afloat. I practiced with it once and I am pleased with it's easecof use as well as re-packing. Highly suggest this product.
customer_reviews.author: Captn' Bob

customer_reviews.title: Thankfully unused.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't needed it yet, thankfully. Kept in my car due to living in an area which has experienced multiple lethal flooding episodes and when someone's caught in a flow, this is the only option to help without being a working swift-water tech. (Yes I've had training so as to not just rely on a couple YouTube videos, but when not in a rescue PFD and working with a team, these are a subjects best hope)
customer_reviews.author: colo

customer_reviews.title: Opening too narrow to re-stuff the rope quickly
customer_reviews.text: I've used this bag several times & would give it a 5 star instead of 4, except I found the bag is so narrow that re-stuffing the rope is a very slow process. A bag with a wider opening would make re-stuffing it go much faster.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a great rope
customer_reviews.text: This appears to be well constructed. The rope looks good, the bag is good quality. It's small enough to easily take with you. It's easy to accurately deploy the full length of the rope. I'm very surprised at the quality for the price, I'm happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: TimH

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tool to have in your rescue equipment bag
customer_reviews.text: Came in on time. Easy to throw unlike other throw bags that I've used. The rope is not stiff. And the length is just perfect. Hopefully I'll never need to use it but if I do i have confidence that it will work as intended.
customer_reviews.author: David Little

customer_reviews.title: Great value....
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value for an emergency throw bag. It is compact and stows away easily while allowing you to keep a 50' life line at the ready. I only ordered one to check this out first but when I saw the quality, I immediately ordered a second one. A must for any kayaker.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFan

customer_reviews.title: easy to throw
customer_reviews.text: Fades quickly in the sun, easy to throw. I would suggest looking around as there are better deals.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: ... the cheaper end of the spectrum but it seems like other does not lack in quality
customer_reviews.text: This throw bag is cheap and at the cheaper end of the spectrum but it seems like other does not lack in quality. It throws smoothly, floats, and is lightweight when dry. A good thing to have handy during flooding.
customer_reviews.author: Anglr200

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Going to be a perfect addition to our safety equipment already onboard our vessel.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn A. Starring

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for my husband who has just started canoeing ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband who has just started canoeing. He really likes it. It is lightweight and compact. Doesn't take up much space in the canoe and is an added safety feature he appreciates.
customer_reviews.author: zna2212

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to carry on my kayak. It's compact and constructed well. There's even pictures printed on the bag showing how to use it. The first time trying it, I was able to deploy the entire 50 ft. of line with only a minimal toss. Amazing performance at such an affordable price!
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Its a rope in a bag?!
customer_reviews.text: I have not had to use this in an emergancy but it worked great for towing a capsized kayak to shore. It dries and repacks easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah Bock

customer_reviews.title: Great price and is good quality
customer_reviews.text: Great price and is good quality. Haven't used it in a real situation but certainly have practiced with it. Focus on Prevention
customer_reviews.author: Austin Lacroix

customer_reviews.title: Meets requirements!
customer_reviews.text: This is mandatory equipment in most places so it's one of those items that I hope I never have to use but know it's there and ready to go. Seems well made and I not sure how well it works because I haven't tried it yet even though I know it's something that should be practiced with. Well made low cost piece of safety equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Windnut

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I use this when training Cub Scouts and Boy Scouts. It is light weight and durable, making it the perfect throw bag for this purpose. The rope coils into the bag easily and I have not had problems with it getting tangled.
customer_reviews.author: E L Kirke

customer_reviews.title: Super price, quality product.
customer_reviews.text: I can't say much about this one. It's a rope bag... with 50 ft. of rope... and a clip strap on one end to attach to your boat... I mean it's just like all the others that I looked at, except it costs what it should. I couldn't believe what other similar (identical) throw bags were going for, come on, just buy this one and feel relatively safe.
customer_reviews.author: theallen

customer_reviews.title: Works as well as bags, and is a third the cost.
customer_reviews.text: I've had numerous training classes regarding use of these throw bags. This bag, despite it's price, does as well as any brand you will find. Very solid construction. It hangs in my boat just waiting to be used. Hopefully it will never have to be!
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: good idea
customer_reviews.text: We have larger throw bags that we take white water rafting but got this one for our drift boat after an experience in BC reminded us you don't have to be in white water to get into a pickle! It's a convenient no-hassle safety tool
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mandatory!
customer_reviews.text: If you do any kayaking at all you need a throw bag. Once you're in water over your head handling a kayak in an emergency is tricky and difficult. Fast rivers are a challenge for even the best if you are upset. Be prepared.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Gaudreau

customer_reviews.title: Good quality emergency rope bag
customer_reviews.text: Never had to use it, but tried it to get familiar with throwing it. It's easy to use and the put back together. Clips on my watercraft for easy access and the bright bag makes it easy to see.
customer_reviews.author: FoxSoap

customer_reviews.title: Nice size and brightly colored so you can see it ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice size and brightly colored so you can see it in a hurry!! Haven't had to use, but one never knows when you are out on the water!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara, RN, BSN

customer_reviews.title: Get one
customer_reviews.text: Great item that every boater should carry for an emergency rescue.
customer_reviews.author: JeT

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Pulled it out to check quality of rope and was very please. Was used once to move a log. Have yet to use it to rescue but hopefully I won't need to!
customer_reviews.author: Tony Guillen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice price and product. Will use for my rowboat, and training Scout Troop for rank advancement.
customer_reviews.author: Cashew

customer_reviews.title: Jenn
customer_reviews.text: We really hope we don't need to use this.......however it looks as if it will work well if needed. Nice and compact and fits into our kayak as part of our safety equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: easy to deploy
customer_reviews.text: Works well, easy to deploy, and a good length of rope.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Great training tool!
customer_reviews.text: I am a Scuba Intructor and use this for Stess and Rescue classes. It is compact, and easy to store. Works very well for training purposes. I am satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brad S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good addition for boating on Lake Michigan
customer_reviews.text: A gift for my husband fisherman - living on Lake Michigan and small lakes, a great safety feature.
customer_reviews.author: home shopper

customer_reviews.title: Something every boat should have
customer_reviews.text: Well made and a good safety item to have on the boat.
customer_reviews.author: Able

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Got one in my 25' boat and another in my raft. Just in case...
customer_reviews.author: Heinz

customer_reviews.title: life line rescue
customer_reviews.text: We did a experiment trial, the rope was only 46 feet in length total......have to replace the rope to 50 feet
customer_reviews.author: Wanmowkoh

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Decent compact inexpensive throw bag. I use the compact ones on my PWCs, Packrafts, etc..
customer_reviews.author: Avalanche Timm,

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Follow directions and throw it, and it deploys perfectly. Well thought out, good materials, well built, stores neatly, and is quick to deploy. Price was the clincher.
customer_reviews.author: Swanny

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Well made Easy to use Heavy duty Easy to install Great product Little to expensive But it is working well
customer_reviews.author: Eugene Sapiro

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine at a cheaper price than a lot of bags I considered. Easy to carry and like the color.
customer_reviews.author: lcmon

customer_reviews.title: A must for boat safety
customer_reviews.text: Great add to my throw ring. Stores easily and always ready and knot free
customer_reviews.author: BobM

customer_reviews.title: Just in case
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect length for most casual paddlers. Nice to have handy if someone has trouble. Well made and worth the money no doubt.
customer_reviews.author: Mavis Shanks

customer_reviews.title: Feels good in my hand
customer_reviews.text: Feels good in my hand. I hope not to use this but just in case I have something to save someone.
customer_reviews.author: Bert de Leon

customer_reviews.title: SAVE A LIFE
customer_reviews.text: LOOKS LIKE IT WILL DO GOOD AT REACHING WATER OCCUPANT ; HOWEVER, I TRULY HOPE I NEVER HAVE TO USE IT
customer_reviews.author: Grace Sumner

customer_reviews.title: Passed inspection
customer_reviews.text: For the boat, passed the Coast Guard inspection with flying colors
customer_reviews.author: Harry H from Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just as described, thank you. I would order this again.
customer_reviews.author: Titan

customer_reviews.title: Kwik Tek LL-1 Life Line Rescue Throw Bag 50 Feet
customer_reviews.text: The Kwik Tek LL-1 Life Line Rescue Throw Bag 50 Feet is exactly what is described on-line. It arrived quickly and when we went canoeing we tried it out and it is easy to throw and even when you fill the bag up with water for a 2nd throw that works well too. Restuffing the line into the bag is a little more effort because it is more of a tube than a bag, but it is still a very useable product. Buy it and have it ready when you need it!!
customer_reviews.author: JohnP

customer_reviews.title: A nice feature is the buckle for securing it to the ...
customer_reviews.text: Dries out quickly to prevent mold/rot. A nice feature is the buckle for securing it to the boat.
customer_reviews.author: Steve H.

customer_reviews.title: Looks practical
customer_reviews.text: A good product that hopefully you will not have to use.
customer_reviews.author: Flamethrower

customer_reviews.title: Line line throw bag
customer_reviews.text: Reasonable price for a necessary safety measure in any boating situation.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy A. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: for boating safety it is recommended. Buy it and you will be ready to ...
customer_reviews.text: I hope I never have to use it. However, for boating safety it is recommended. Buy it and you will be ready to save a life.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Whyte

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Affordable
customer_reviews.text: This is not too large and simple enough that most anyone can use it right away. Storage is not an issue since it is small. Hope I never have to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Elopez

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: ended up using it as a bow line, soft rope, goes back in the bag with ease. Glad we got it.
customer_reviews.author: mtcat

customer_reviews.title: Good product for adventure race
customer_reviews.text: Excelent product, very small and lighting, for adventure race it is the perfect item that you have to buy.the rope work fine when you have to use it but you have to drop hard for it.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Velez Bravo

customer_reviews.title: Great for boating rescue
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, compact, easy to use and very well built.
customer_reviews.author: P Shanteau

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought for my Son, he kayaks. It's one of those things you need and hope do not have to use.
customer_reviews.author: Luann

customer_reviews.title: It is exactly as expected. Pulled some line out ...
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly as expected. Pulled some line out to check it but haven't had to use it in an emergency yet. Thank goodness.
customer_reviews.author: Reel-in-sanity

customer_reviews.title: Nicely constructed, and works well.
customer_reviews.text: It is nicely constructed, and works well during practice. I plan to buy a couple more for friends that need one.
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: It is nice & easy to deploy
customer_reviews.text: For the price & the fact that this is a safety item, I hopefully will never use. It is nice & easy to deploy.
customer_reviews.author: david kleiman

customer_reviews.title: It is OK meets inshore GC rules
customer_reviews.text: it's OK it meets GC rules inshore for rescue device - BUT could have been described in add better ...
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: The Best Value in a Quality Water Rescue Throw Bag!
customer_reviews.text: We are a rafting and kayaking family, with two adults and our young children, too! We each carry these for emergency use in our kayaks whenever we head out. In addition, we secure all four in our raft in case they are needed, ensuring that we will be able to deploy one or more in emergency situations. These are lightweight and easy to use. Our youngest, a first grader, can easily toss this when needed. We also use these with the Scouts in training them in water rescue techniques. You cannot beat the quality, reliability and ease of use with these throw bags....all important factors for something that can and will save lives!
customer_reviews.author: Cha Chi

customer_reviews.title: Small and Light
customer_reviews.text: This is a small bag with a pretty tight fit for the rope, so it takes a little longer to repack. The light weight makes backhand Frisbee style throws. I prefer this bag, however the it needs to be cinched-up real tight or the rope can dribble out.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Water

customer_reviews.title: throw bag
customer_reviews.text: Just started kayaking in August and started thinking about things we might need. Found the throw bag on Amazon. The transaction was easy, kept well informed, and product arrived earlier than expected. Haven't had an emergency to use the product but very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: ladd foster

customer_reviews.title: I have not found a need for it yet (Thank God)...
customer_reviews.text: Folks, Well.... Being that its use appears to be that if some one falls overboard... you throw it to them? I hope that I never have a need for it. The Coast Guard appreciates seeing it hanging some were in plane site on your boat. If they're happy... I'm happy. Hence, Five (5) stars. Rascal
customer_reviews.author: Rascal

customer_reviews.title: rescue bag
customer_reviews.text: the kwik tek rescue throw bag was just what i needed it can hang on the dock and go with me in the boat. If i never have to use it. it would be worth it,s weight in gold.
customer_reviews.author: diane

customer_reviews.title: The clip cones apart to easy.
customer_reviews.text: Yes it was very helpful on my Jet Ski until I got a wave and lost it in the ocean. The clip cones apart to easy.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Barbano

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Great buy- Bag is canvas, rope is lightweight poly that floats.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Jones

customer_reviews.title: Much better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: Like others have said, don't let the low price scare you away. Looks very well made. I am ordering a second one to attach to our ring buoy!
customer_reviews.author: Kirk G Grier

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect
customer_reviews.text: Bought this based on the good reviews and I have not been let down. Used it this weekend for a rescue and it performed exactly as it should. Quality seems high, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: goinout

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Only request is if it came with instructions on repacking the rope after use.
customer_reviews.author: Darrick W.

customer_reviews.title: Throw Bag Meets Boating Regulations...
customer_reviews.text: Amazon offers this great product at a excellent value price vs. other sources online. I was very pleased when I received the Rescue Throw Bag and checked out its design.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Wise

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not the best.
customer_reviews.text: End grommet pulled out of the bag the very first practice throw.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very easy and effective to use
customer_reviews.text: Ideal, very easy and effective to use, a must have for all Boaters
customer_reviews.author: Robert Cadzow

customer_reviews.title: Good bag
customer_reviews.text: It's a good bag. It does the job that is was made to do rather well. No frills attached. Bye!
customer_reviews.author: GreatDeels

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: I had a situtiation last year were I could have used this, so I bought it. I feel a little silly having it on the front of my kayak and I'm the only one out there with one but I also know if I ever have to use it someone is going to be very thankful I had it. I'm big on safty on all my boats (I have six fishing row boats) and I'm 69 years old so I don't mind looking a bit silly. I also carry a sump-pump, a light tow rope and a small first aid kit.
customer_reviews.author: carnation

customer_reviews.title: Every boat owner should have one
customer_reviews.text: This is great,for the price every boat owner should have one an not have a reason not to. Highly Recomended
customer_reviews.author: Smokin Joe

customer_reviews.title: Throw bag
customer_reviews.text: Around the water a lot and feel the need to have something to help if something should happen. This is well made and worth the cost to have safety on the pier or on the boat.
customer_reviews.author: N. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Need it but hope I don't have to use it
customer_reviews.text: This throw bag is great to have in the boat incase of an emergency. Takes up less space then a throw ring and was a great price. We have not used it and hope we don't have an emergency but if we do need it will be useful. Better safe then sorry.
customer_reviews.author: JJ on the coast

customer_reviews.title: No regrets on getting this throw bag
customer_reviews.text: I was a little concerned as there are a wide range of prices on throw bags. I needed two more bags for a scout canoe trip in 10 days. I ordered two and got free regular shipping and they get here in two days on a Sunday! Nice bags, no issues.
customer_reviews.author: skeeter

customer_reviews.title: Kwik  Tek line
customer_reviews.text: I have not used yet but will work great for what I need
customer_reviews.author: Lilsugar61240

customer_reviews.title: Safty First
customer_reviews.text: Got two of them. One for boat and one for life ring on pier after my dog fell in the cold lake on December night and I had to go into get him. We almost didn't get to shore.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lominack

customer_reviews.title: great safety device
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband to carry with him while ice fishing. You can never have too much safety equipment.
customer_reviews.author: diana

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Good product at a good price. Arrived in stated time and in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: Karol A. Shelley

customer_reviews.title: as promised
customer_reviews.text: the product was delivered promised and seems to be exactly what I thought it was. Haven't had the need to use it yet - hopefully never will.
customer_reviews.author: piper

customer_reviews.title: Kwik Tek LL-1 Life Line Throw Bag
customer_reviews.text: A great value! less expensive than most throw lines. Will last a life time. Easy to toss when wet.
customer_reviews.author: Yanet

customer_reviews.title: safety first!
customer_reviews.text: I have not had to use this life line and hope I never will BUT to know it is with you in that off chance you may need it has some peace of mind built in. It appears to be a simple safety piece of equipment to have with you. It is fairly compact and light weight. One never knows, the life you safe may be your own.
customer_reviews.author: blhersey

product_meta.title: LIFE LINE Rescue Throw Bag, 50 ft.
product_meta.description: LIFE LINE Rescue Throw Bag - You’ll be astonished how easy it is to throw this 50 ft. rescue line with incredible accuracy to a swimmer in trouble. Keep LIFE LINE accessible by hanging it from a boat rail or other convenient spot with the integrated strap with side release buckle. Easy to understand and implement directions with graphics are printed on the outside. Constructed of rugged bright orange, UV-resistant 600-denier polyester. Great for snowmobiles on frozen lakes too!
feature_bullets: Integrated strap with side release buckle

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
